required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of Ulocuplumab and Nivolumab in Subjects With Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1/2 Study of the Safety and Efficacy of Ulocuplumab Combined With Nivolumab in Subjects With Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the combination of Ulocuplumab and Nivolumab is safe and effective in the treatment of pancreatic cancer and small cell lung cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
- Intervention model: Single group for Stage 1 DLT, then Parallel
- Data Monitoring Committee: No (Stage 1) Yes (Stage 2 Randomized Ph2)

clinical_study.why_stopped: Trial terminated because of lack of efficacy in the short term acute phase

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), and Immune-mediated AEs
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose until date of last dose of ulocuplumab or nivolumab plus 100 days (assessed up to January 2017, approximately 18 months)
primary_outcome.description: The number participants who experienced on-study AEs, SAEs, and AEs requiring immune modulating medication is reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Objective Response Rate (ORR) Per RECIST 1.1 Criteria
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose until disease progression or treatment discontinuation (assessed up to January 2017, approximately 18 months)
primary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the number of participants with a best overall response (BOR) of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) divided by the number of treated participants. BOR is defined as the best response designation recorded between the first dose date and the date of progression per RECIST 1.1, or the date of subsequent anti-cancer therapy, whichever occurs first. CR= Disappearance of all target lesions. Any pathological lymph nodes must have reduction in short axis to <10 mm. PR= At least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters. Progressive Disease (PD)=At least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of target lesions, referencing the smallest sum on study, and an absolute increase of at least 5 mm, or the appearance of one or more new lesions. Stable Disease (SD): Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, referencing the smallest sum diameters while on study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization to date of death (assessed up to study completion, approximately 18 months)
primary_outcome.description: If a Phase 2 comparative study is initiated and, for PAC only: Overall Survival is defined as the time from randomization to date of death due to any cause.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Laboratory Abnormalities
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose until date of last dose of ulocuplumab or nivolumab plus 100 days (assessed up to January 2017, approximately 18 months)
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants who experienced on-study Grade 3 or 4 laboratory abnormalities (without Grade 3 or 4 abnormality at baseline) was reported for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Electrocardiogram Abnormalities
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to date of last dose plus 30 days
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants experiencing electrocardiogram abnormalities was reported for each arm

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to date of progression (assessed up to January 2017, approximately 18 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival is defined as the time from first dosing date to the date of the first documented tumor progression, as determined by the investigator according to RECIST 1.1 criteria, or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. Participants who die without a reported prior progression will be considered to have progressed on the date of their death. PFS was not assessed for this study due to the small number of participants.

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding BMS clinical trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- SCLC or PAC that is advanced or has spread to other parts of the body
- Treated with at least one other chemotherapy that did not work or where cancer relapsed
- Minimal limitations on activities of daily living as measured by Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) score of 0-1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with cancer that spread to the brain
- Active, known or suspected autoimmune disease
- Prior treatment with any drug that targets T cell co-stimulation pathways (such as checkpoint inhibitors)

facility.name: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center At Johns Hopkins

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 61 participants were enrolled; 41 participants entered the treatment period.

group.title: PAC DL1 (DLT)
group.description: Pancreatic Adenocarcinoma (PAC) Dose level 1, 400 mg ulocuplumab QW + 3 mg/kg nivolumab Q2W

group.title: PAC DL-1 (Tot)
group.description: Pancreatic Adenocarcinoma (PAC) Dose level -1, 200 mg ulocuplumab QW + 3 mg/kg nivolumab Q2W

group.title: SCLC (Tot)
group.description: All Small Cell Lung Cancer (SCLC) subjects in study, 1 subject received 400 mg ulocuplumab QW + 3 mg/kg nivolumab Q2W and 7 subjects received 200 mg ulocuplumab QW + 3 mg/kg nivolumab Q2W

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), and Immune-mediated AEs
outcome.description: The number participants who experienced on-study AEs, SAEs, and AEs requiring immune modulating medication is reported.
outcome.time_frame: From first dose until date of last dose of ulocuplumab or nivolumab plus 100 days (assessed up to January 2017, approximately 18 months)
outcome.population: All treated participants. Participants in the SCLC (Tot) Arm were not evaluated for Immune-mediated AEs

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), and Immune-mediated AEs
measure.description: The number participants who experienced on-study AEs, SAEs, and AEs requiring immune modulating medication is reported.
measure.population: All treated participants. Participants in the SCLC (Tot) Arm were not evaluated for Immune-mediated AEs

outcome.title: Objective Response Rate (ORR) Per RECIST 1.1 Criteria
outcome.description: ORR is defined as the number of participants with a best overall response (BOR) of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) divided by the number of treated participants. BOR is defined as the best response designation recorded between the first dose date and the date of progression per RECIST 1.1, or the date of subsequent anti-cancer therapy, whichever occurs first. CR= Disappearance of all target lesions. Any pathological lymph nodes must have reduction in short axis to <10 mm. PR= At least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters. Progressive Disease (PD)=At least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of target lesions, referencing the smallest sum on study, and an absolute increase of at least 5 mm, or the appearance of one or more new lesions. Stable Disease (SD): Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, referencing the smallest sum diameters while on study.
outcome.time_frame: From first dose until disease progression or treatment discontinuation (assessed up to January 2017, approximately 18 months)
outcome.population: All treated participants in PAC arms. ORR data was not collected for SCLC arm.

measure.title: Objective Response Rate (ORR) Per RECIST 1.1 Criteria
measure.description: ORR is defined as the number of participants with a best overall response (BOR) of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) divided by the number of treated participants. BOR is defined as the best response designation recorded between the first dose date and the date of progression per RECIST 1.1, or the date of subsequent anti-cancer therapy, whichever occurs first. CR= Disappearance of all target lesions. Any pathological lymph nodes must have reduction in short axis to <10 mm. PR= At least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters. Progressive Disease (PD)=At least a 20% increase in the sum of diameters of target lesions, referencing the smallest sum on study, and an absolute increase of at least 5 mm, or the appearance of one or more new lesions. Stable Disease (SD): Neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for PR nor sufficient increase to qualify for PD, referencing the smallest sum diameters while on study.
measure.population: All treated participants in PAC arms. ORR data was not collected for SCLC arm.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: If a Phase 2 comparative study is initiated and, for PAC only: Overall Survival is defined as the time from randomization to date of death due to any cause.
outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization to date of death (assessed up to study completion, approximately 18 months)
outcome.population: OS data was not collected for any participants

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: Progression-free survival is defined as the time from first dosing date to the date of the first documented tumor progression, as determined by the investigator according to RECIST 1.1 criteria, or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. Participants who die without a reported prior progression will be considered to have progressed on the date of their death. PFS was not assessed for this study due to the small number of participants.
outcome.time_frame: From first dose to date of progression (assessed up to January 2017, approximately 18 months)
outcome.population: PFS data was not collected for any participants

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period 60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
